name: Path T Melanoma Mouth Other
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore, T1 and T2 are omitted as are Stages I and II. 

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of oral site

Extension involving mucosa only to adjacent sites in oral cavity including tongue

Extension involving mucosa only:
    Inferior surface of soft palate including uvula
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Lingual surface of epiglottis
    Oropharynx, NOS
    Vallecula

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

    Genioglossus

Stated as T4a
